intro: Tabernaemontana laevis, commonly known as the smooth tabernaemontana, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its elegant appearance and long-lasting blooms. However, it is important to note that all parts of the plant are toxic and should be handled with care.
